intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion pyrenaeojurassicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean-Jurassic hawkweed, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in calcareous grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, lanceolate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
